content.body: Same-origin CORS requests have their response tainting set to "`basic`", so they don't get an origin header
content.formatted_body: Same-origin CORS requests have their response tainting set to "basic", so they don't get an origin header

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Same-origin CORS requests have their response tainting set to "`basic`", so they don't get an origin header
Same-origin CORS requests have their response tainting set to "basic", so they don't get an origin header

content.body: For non-GET requests we do need to set the header though, the current spec is not web compatible https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/1022
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: For non-GET requests we do need to set the header though, the current spec is not web compatible https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/1022

content.body: Not off the top of my head

Yeah I took a quick look at the Gecko sources in the hope it might be easy to see what conditions would lead to that error message being emitted, but that quick look was enough to see that a much longer look would be needed to figure it out..
